00149 int nfs_Read( nfs_arg_t             * parg,    
00150               exportlist_t          * pexport, 
00151               fsal_op_context_t     * pcontext,   
00152               cache_inode_client_t  * pclient,
00153               hash_table_t          * ht,
00154               struct svc_req        * preq,    
00155               nfs_res_t             * pres )
00156 {
00157   static char  __attribute__(( __unused__ ))      funcName[] = "nfs_Read";
00158         
00159   cache_entry_t            * pentry ;
00160   fsal_attrib_list_t         attr ;
00161   fsal_attrib_list_t         pre_attr ;
00162   fsal_attrib_list_t       * ppre_attr ;
00163   int                        rc ;
00164   cache_inode_status_t       cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS;
00165   cache_content_status_t     content_status ;
00166   fsal_seek_t                seek_descriptor ;
00167   fsal_size_t                size = 0;
00168   fsal_size_t                read_size;
00169   fsal_off_t                 offset = 0;
00170   caddr_t                    data = NULL;
00171   cache_inode_file_type_t    filetype ;
00172   fsal_boolean_t             eof_met  ;
00173 
00174   cache_content_policy_data_t datapol ; 
00175 
00176   datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = FALSE ;
00177 
00178   if (preq->rq_vers == NFS_V3)
00179    {
00180         /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00181         pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00182    }
00183 
00184   
00185         /* Convert file handle into a cache entry */
00186   if( ( pentry = nfs_FhandleToCache( preq->rq_vers, 
00187                                      &(parg->arg_read2.file),
00188                                      &(parg->arg_read3.file),
00189                                      NULL, 
00190                                      &(pres->res_read2.status),
00191                                      &(pres->res_read3.status),
00192                                      NULL,
00193                                      &pre_attr, 
00194                                      pcontext, 
00195                                      pclient, 
00196                                      ht, 
00197                                      &rc ) ) == NULL )
00198     {
00199       /* Stale NFS FH ? */
00200       return rc ;
00201     }
00202 
00203   if( ( preq->rq_vers == NFS_V3 ) &&
00204       ( nfs3_Is_Fh_Xattr(  &(parg->arg_read3.file) ) ) ) 
00205      return nfs3_Read_Xattr( parg, 
00206                              pexport, 
00207                              pcontext,
00208                              pclient,
00209                              ht,
00210                              preq, 
00211                              pres ) ;
00212 
00213   /* get directory attributes before action (for V3 reply) */
00214   ppre_attr = &pre_attr;
00215   
00216   /* Extract the filetype */
00217   filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( pre_attr.type ) ;
00218 
00219   /* Sanity check: read only from a regular file */
00220         if( filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00221     {
00222       switch (preq->rq_vers)
00223         {
00224         case NFS_V2:
00225           /*
00226            * In the RFC tell it not good but it does
00227            * not tell what to do ... 
00228            */
00229           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_ISDIR;
00230           break;
00231 
00232         case NFS_V3:
00233           if( filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00234             pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_ISDIR ;
00235           else
00236             pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL;
00237           break;
00238         }
00239   
00240       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00241     }
00242   
00243   /* For MDONLY export, reject write operation */
00244   /* Request of type MDONLY_RO were rejected at the nfs_rpc_dispatcher level */
00245   /* This is done by replying EDQUOT (this error is known for not disturbing the client's requests cache */
00246   if( pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY || pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO )
00247     {
00248       switch( preq->rq_vers )
00249         {
00250         case NFS_V2:
00251           pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_DQUOT ;
00252           break;
00253 
00254         case NFS_V3:
00255           pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_DQUOT;
00256           break;
00257         }
00258 
00259   
00260       nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00261                            preq->rq_vers, 
00262                            cache_status,
00263                            &pres->res_read2.status,
00264                            &pres->res_read3.status,
00265                            pentry,
00266                            &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00267                            NULL, NULL, NULL,
00268                            NULL, NULL, NULL);
00269       
00270       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00271     }
00272   
00273   /* Extract the argument from the request */
00274         switch( preq->rq_vers )
00275         {
00276         case NFS_V2:
00277     offset = parg->arg_read2.offset;    /* beginoffset is obsolete */
00278     size = parg->arg_read2.count;           /* totalcount is obsolete  */
00279     break;
00280 
00281         case NFS_V3:
00282     offset = parg->arg_read3.offset;
00283     size = parg->arg_read3.count;
00284 
00285 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00286     printf( "-----> Read offset=%lld count=%u MaxOffSet=%lld\n", parg->arg_read3.offset, parg->arg_read3.count, pexport->MaxOffsetRead ) ;
00287 #endif
00288 
00289 
00290     /* 
00291      * do not exceed maxium READ/WRITE offset if set 
00292      */
00293     if( ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD ) == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETREAD )
00294      if( (fsal_off_t)(offset+size) > pexport->MaxOffsetRead ) 
00295        {
00296           
00297           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT,
00298               "NFS READ: A client tryed to violate max file size %lld for exportid #%hu",
00299               pexport->MaxOffsetRead, pexport->id ) ;
00300 
00301           switch( preq->rq_vers )
00302                 {
00303                 case NFS_V2:
00304                 pres->res_attr2.status = NFSERR_DQUOT ;
00305                 break;
00306 
00307                 case NFS_V3:
00308                 pres->res_read3.status = NFS3ERR_INVAL;
00309                 break;
00310                 }
00311 
00312 
00313           nfs_SetFailedStatus(  pcontext, pexport,
00314                                 preq->rq_vers,
00315                                 cache_status,
00316                                 &pres->res_read2.status,
00317                                 &pres->res_read3.status,
00318                                 pentry,
00319                                 &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00320                                 NULL, NULL, NULL,
00321                                 NULL, NULL, NULL);
00322 
00323           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00324 
00325         }
00326         
00327 
00328     /*
00329      * We should not exceed the FSINFO rtmax field for
00330      * the size 
00331      */
00332     if(  ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXREAD ) &&
00333            size > pexport->MaxRead )
00334                         {
00335                                 /*
00336                                  * The client asked for too much, normally
00337                                  * this should not happen because the client
00338                                  * is calling nfs_Fsinfo at mount time and so
00339                                  * is aware of the server maximum write size 
00340                                  */
00341                                 size =  pexport->MaxRead ;
00342                         }
00343     break;
00344         }
00345   
00346         if (size == 0)
00347     {
00348       cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00349       read_size = 0;
00350       data = NULL;
00351         } 
00352   else
00353         {
00354                 data = Mem_Alloc( size );
00355 
00356                 if (data == NULL)
00357                 {
00358                         return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00359                 }
00360 
00361     seek_descriptor.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
00362     seek_descriptor.offset = offset ;
00363    
00364     datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXCACHESIZE ;
00365     datapol.MaxCacheSize = pexport->MaxCacheSize ;
00366  
00367     /* If export is not cached, cache it now */
00368     if( ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE ) && 
00369         ( cache_content_cache_behaviour( pentry, 
00370                                          &datapol,
00371                                          (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00372                                          &content_status ) == CACHE_CONTENT_FULLY_CACHED ) && 
00373         ( pentry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL ) )
00374       {
00375         /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it */
00376         cache_inode_add_data_cache( pentry, ht, pclient, pcontext, &cache_status ) ;
00377         if( ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) && 
00378             ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS ) )
00379           {
00380             /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it .
00381              * Several threads may call this function at the first time and a race condition can occur here
00382              * in order to avoid this, cache_inode_add_data_cache is "mutex protected" 
00383              * The first call will create the file content cache entry, the further will return
00384              * with error CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS which is not a pathological thing here */
00385             
00386             /* If we are here, there was an error */
00387             if (nfs_RetryableError( cache_status ) )
00388               {
00389                 return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00390               }
00391             
00392             nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00393                                  preq->rq_vers, 
00394                                  cache_status,
00395                                  &pres->res_read2.status,
00396                                  &pres->res_read3.status,
00397                                  pentry,
00398                                  &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00399                                  NULL, NULL, NULL,
00400                                  NULL, NULL, NULL);
00401             
00402             return NFS_REQ_OK;
00403           }
00404       }
00405     
00406 
00407     if( cache_inode_rdwr( pentry, 
00408                           CACHE_CONTENT_READ, 
00409                           &seek_descriptor,
00410                           size,
00411                           &read_size,
00412                           &attr,
00413                           data, 
00414                           &eof_met,
00415                           ht, 
00416                           pclient, 
00417                           pcontext, 
00418                           &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00419       
00420       {
00421         switch (preq->rq_vers)
00422           {
00423           case NFS_V2:
00424             pres->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_val = data;
00425             pres->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_len = read_size ;
00426 
00427             nfs2_FSALattr_To_Fattr( pexport, &attr,
00428                                     &(pres->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.attributes) ) ;
00429 
00430             pres->res_attr2.status = NFS_OK;
00431             break;
00432 
00433           case NFS_V3:
00434 
00435             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.eof = FALSE;
00436 
00437             /* Did we reach eof ? */
00438             /* BUGAZOMEU use eof */
00439                                                 if( (offset + read_size) >= attr.filesize )
00440                                                         pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.eof = TRUE;
00441 
00442                                                 /* Build Post Op Attributes */
00443                                                 nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext, pexport,
00444                                pentry, 
00445                                &attr,
00446                                &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.file_attributes) );
00447             
00448                                                 pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.file_attributes.attributes_follow = TRUE;
00449 
00450             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.count = read_size ;
00451             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_val = data;
00452             pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_len = read_size ;
00453             
00454             pres->res_read3.status = NFS3_OK;
00455             break;
00456           } /* switch */
00457         
00458         return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00459       }
00460         }
00461 
00462         /* If we are here, there was an error */
00463         if (nfs_RetryableError( cache_status ) )
00464         {
00465                 return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00466         }
00467 
00468         nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00469                        preq->rq_vers, 
00470                        cache_status,
00471                        &pres->res_read2.status,
00472                        &pres->res_read3.status,
00473                        pentry,
00474                        &(pres->res_read3.READ3res_u.resfail.file_attributes),
00475                        NULL, NULL, NULL,
00476                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00477   
00478                 return NFS_REQ_OK;
00479 } /* nfs_Read */
00480 
00481 
00490 void nfs2_Read_Free(nfs_res_t * resp)
00491 {
00492         if ((resp->res_read2.status == NFS_OK) &&
00493             (resp->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_len != 0))
00494                 Mem_Free(resp->res_read2.READ2res_u.readok.data.nfsdata2_val);
00495 } /* nfs2_Read_Free */
00496 
00497 
00506 void nfs3_Read_Free(nfs_res_t * resp)
00507 {
00508         if ((resp->res_read3.status == NFS3_OK) &&
00509             (resp->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_len != 0))
00510           Mem_Free(resp->res_read3.READ3res_u.resok.data.data_val);
00511 } /* nfs3_Read_Free */
